The weekend brings the next warm-up, but Saturday is the pick for outdoor activities: We’ll have partial sunshine and highs well into the 50s.

FORECAST IN DETAIL

Temperatures are up and down this week, but there’s no extreme cold in the offing, which is a nice change of pace from the past four weeks.
Winds from the south at 10 to 15 mph in the morning, shift to coming in from the west at 15 to 20 mph in the afternoon, with gusts to 25 mph or so.
After the rain, skies gradually clear and it turns partly sunny, windy and mild in the afternoon, with highs in the upper 50s to low 60s.
